results.title: Software Engineer Intern - Summer Session (Summer 2026)
results.content:
As a Nimble Engineer, you will help in architecting the technology and customer experience that run Nimble (www.nimblerx.com). You will join a team of world-class, highly motivated software engineers to deliver front-end patterns and practices that ensure developer productivity, a great end-user experience, and a performant website. If you have the aspirations to help drive technical direction, take on technical challenges and design life changing features, come join us!

This is a 40 hour per week (full-time) paid internship opportunity working a hybrid schedule of 3 days/week on-site at our HQ in Redwood City, CA, with a minimum 12-week commitment. [...] What‚Äôs in it for you:

 Compassionate and driven colleagues in a collaborative, high-impact environment
 Coaching from experienced engineering leaders
 Direct access to executives and a transparent company culture
 Rare opportunity to change an industry and lives of millions
 We are reinventing healthcare / pharmacy - your (grand)parents and your (grand)children will understand and appreciate what you do
 Work out of our HQ in beautiful downtown Redwood City

At Nimble, we are dedicated to putting patients first and improving pharmacies across America. Join us on this exciting journey! [...] Diversity, inclusion and belonging at Nimble: Nimble is building a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other. We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of diverse backgrounds, abilities and perspectives.

HQ

## NimbleRx Redwood, California, USA Office

2317 Broadway, Redwood, CA, United States, 94063

#### What you need to know about the San Francisco Tech Scene

results.title: Employee Data and Trends for Nimblerx - Unify
results.content:
## Nimblerx Headcount Breakdown by Department

Sales and Support is the largest function at NimbleRx, accounting for about two-fifths of all employees (59 people). Engineering follows with 42 team members, underscoring the company‚Äôs investment in product development and platform reliability. Smaller yet essential groups include Marketing and Product (15), Operations (10), and Information Technology (7). Business Management, Healthcare, Human Resources, Finance and Administration, and an "Other" category collectively represent the remaining 16 roles, illustrating a lean structure across corporate functions.

Total Employees

NimbleRx, a technology-driven pharmacy platform, maintains a workforce of roughly 150 employees. Recent staffing activity shows 24 hires balanced against 16 departures, resulting in modest net growth. The company draws on both healthcare and software expertise to power its prescription-delivery and patient-engagement services, and its headcount mix reflects that dual focus.

## Nimblerx Headcount Breakdown by Department [...] Business Management

4

Healthcare

Human Resources

Finance and Administration

Other

1

## Nimblerx Employees by Location

NimbleRx‚Äôs talent footprint is geographically diverse. Roughly one-third of employees (46 people) are based in San Francisco, while a sizable remote or undisclosed segment (59 people) is spread across various regions. Additional clusters appear in Phoenix (14) and Chicago (10), with smaller teams in Los Angeles, New York, Toronto, Castle Rock, Detroit, and Charlottesville. This distribution suggests a hybrid model that combines a Bay Area presence with flexible hiring in other U.S. and Canadian markets.

results.title: About Us - Powering The New Age of RCM - InsideDesk
results.content:
TRUSTED BY THE FASTEST-GROWING AND LEADING DSOS

## Our mission is simple

InsideDesk isn‚Äôt just a technology company. We're customer-first and committed to empowering our unsung heroes to achieve greater success in their roles, enabling the entire organization to grow and deliver even better patient care.

## Our team

InsideDesk is powered by a team of talented, mission-driven professionals, many of whom have deep experience in the dental industry. As a fully distributed company, we provide our team the flexibility to work remotely while staying closely aligned around our shared purpose.

Paul Chen

Founder & CEO  
35 years in Software, 5 years in RCM

Eric Gallegos

VP of Innovation and Growth  
10 years Dental Software Revenue Leader

Mark Eckler

Founder

Allen Jorgensen

Founder [...] Contact Us Today! - 855-777-0801 - info@insidedesk.com

855.777.0801LoginGet Demo

# Powering the new age of RCM

Every dental team works hard to deliver exceptional patient care. But too often, the revenue they've earned gets trapped in the complexity of insurance processes.

Behind every successful dental organization are unsung heroes: RCM billers and claim specialists who spend their days navigating complex insurance systems, tracking down payments, and chasing every dollar earned. They turn clinical excellence into organizational success. Yet their contributions often go unrecognized.  
  
We built InsideDesk for them. Our name says it all: we're here for the insiders. The people at their desks across the country are fighting for every dollar their practice has earned. [...] Mark Eckler

Founder

Allen Jorgensen

Founder

## Our company benefits

#### InsideDays

Recharge and reconnect with InsideDays. These are personal days designed for rest, reflection, or passion projects that matter to you.

#### Health Benefits

Comprehensive health coverage that puts your well-being first, with access to care when you need it most.

#### Dental Benefits

Smile with confidence thanks to our dental plan, covering everything from routine cleanings to major procedures.

#### Remote Work

Work from anywhere with the flexibility and trust to thrive because great work isn‚Äôt confined to an office.

#### Improve revenue collection, operational efficiency and visibility

Get Demo

results.title: Launch School Love
results.content:
Christopher Douglas

I've retrofitted a legacy gem to work again without much help, though it's very limited it one it can do. I also contributed a small feature and a bug fix to a VS Code extension written in Typescript.

Iuliu Pop

Within my first month of my job, I have been trusted with leading major projects and features at my first company not only because of how strong my understanding and mastery of fundamental concepts are, but also because of my ability to communicate those ideas effectively to my peers.

READ MORE

Stephen Watzman [...] READ MORE

Jacob deVarennes

The amount of knowledge I have absorbed while working through the curriculum thus far is impressive and launch school presented it in a way that was never overwhelming or intimidating.

Kal Krueger

Thank you for creating Launch School and helping so many of us discover software engineering in a meaningful and life-changing way.

Christian Larwood

Launch School has it figured out. The US educational system could take a page from the pedagogy. Asynchronous modules with TAs that float around if you need any help. Study groups and seminars abound. LS has revolutionized how I approach the learning process.

Justin Shaber [...] READ MORE

Steven Alston

Launch School has successfully removed the veil from what was once magic to me. I now fundamentally understand concepts and abstractions I never knew existed in the first place. I‚Äôm able to look at code from other languages not covered in the curriculum and understand what is going on.

Gabriel De Almeida

During the interview process, I found myself needing to quickly grasp Python‚Äîa programming language not covered in Launch School's curriculum. To my surprise, within just a few days, I successfully passed a take-home test and a live coding interview.

READ MORE

Alex Riviere

answer.answer: Douglas Chen interned at InsideDesk from January to August 2025. He built AWS infrastructure for email processing. This confirms his internship.

results.title: Community Leadership Scholarships - TD Canada Trust
results.content:
Mehak Dhaliwal

Central Peel Secondary School

Caledon, ON

Although Mehak first thought robotics was for boys, she fell in love with the activity when she joined a VEX robotics team. She soon focused on making Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) education more accessible and inclusive. Mehak co-founded SPARK, a non-profit student group that held hackathon events and challenged more than 1,000 middle and high school students to solve real-world problems. Mehak also inspired others by organizing annual Girl Powered events and founding an all-girls VEX robotics team. As Dance Team Captain, she shared Indian folk dance at her school.

Image 72

Jolie Gan

Sir Winston Churchill High School

Calgary, AB

question: did douglas chen (ubc student) win at a hackathon with a project called ELOv?

answer.query: did douglas chen (ubc student) win at a hackathon with a project called ELOv?

results.title: .@UBCBizTech x @Fetch_ai_IL Innovation Lab - Meet the winners ...
results.content: The results are in. Here is the top project: 1st Prize ‚Üí ELOv. Joanna Xu, Jenise Yang and Douglas Chen built ELOv, a leetcode-style training ground where

results.title: #hackathon #ai #leetcode #startup #dating #communication #fetchai
results.content:
We won by building a LeetCode Dating Sim
I don‚Äôt know how to talk to women. And after interviewing 60 young adults, I realized I wasn't alone.
So we built ELOv, a training ground to grind your communication skills and get ranked on the global leaderboard. Chat with AIs across romantic scenarios and get instant feedback.
In 24 hours:
‚Ä¢ 70+ registered users
‚Ä¢ 250+ scenarios played out
‚Ä¢ 17 min average session
In 7 days at KickStart, we pivoted 4 times, lost a teammate, and went all in on the craziest product ‚Äì and somehow, won the Best Use of Fetch AI Award. [...] We had no chance without the fire designs and powerful pitch that Joanna Xu and Jenise Yang cooked up over sleepless nights. I‚Äôm super lucky and thankful to have a strong team that persevered through countless pivots and debates. Y‚Äôall are the GOAT üî•
With only 2 days till judging, I went into a cave and coded the app in 10 hours. Then drove 15K views by marketing across socials.
Huge shout out to
‚Ä¢ UBC BizTech and Gautham Venkateshwaran for hosting and organizing KickStart
‚Ä¢ Tanay Mahendru, Stephanie Ho, and Sam Guarascio for their mentorship, support, and laughs
‚Ä¢ Ryan Tran for his guidance on building AI agents
‚Ä¢ And Fetch.ai for choosing us!
Try ELOv: 
Devpost: 
#hackathon #AI #LeetCode #startup #dating #communication #FetchAI [...] ##### Transcript

results.title: Douglas Chen
results.content:
Douglas Chen

Douglas Chen

Software Developer

Computer Science @ UBC

View Resume

View Resume

.

Machine Learning Algorithms C++

PROJECT

Personal Website

Built a sleek and responsive portfolio using Deno, React, and Vite. Leveraged AI tools to scaffold the initial layout, then customized design details‚Äîspacing, color palette, and component structure‚Äîfor visual clarity and long-term maintainability. The site serves as a creative outlet and a central hub for showcasing my work.

Deno React Vite AI-Assisted

PROJECT

Froggi [...] PROJECT

Portal Wizard

Portal Wizard is a Java-based dungeon game where you play as an ancient wizard who uses spatial magic‚Äîspecifically, Portal Magic‚Äîto outsmart enemies and navigate a world full of danger. Embark on a journey to defeat Desmond Froid, the world's most powerful fire wizard, using creativity, strategy, and dimensional manipulation.

Java LibGDX JProfiler

PROJECT

Roblox Medieval Tycoon

Build your empire, command your army, and conquer your enemies. In this Roblox tycoon game, you don't just collect resources‚Äîyou lead. I designed and developed the core NPC system that lets players recruit soldiers, issue commands, and defend their territory in real time.

Roblox Dev Lua NPC

PROJECT

Multiplayer Third Person Shooter [...] PROJECT

Multiplayer Third Person Shooter

Built with Godot Engine's Networking API, this LAN-based multiplayer TPS allows players to host or join matches using IP addresses. While designed for local play, online functionality is possible through Hamachi.

Godot Engine Networking

PROJECT

Platformer Sandbox

This 2D platformer sandbox was built to experiment with player effects and mechanics, including portals, boosts, jump pads, drop-through platforms, enemy cannons, and a health system. It features a smooth camera and responsive controls for testing platforming interactions in a focused environment.

Gamemaker Studio 2

Design inspired by brittanychiang.com

question: did douglas chen (ubc student) build free food @ ubc project?

results.title: How UBC student Cody Rector is tackling food insecurity
results.content:
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not looking to disrupt the food industry; I‚Äôm looking to provide a real, tangible mechanism for addressing food insecurity,‚Äù says Cody. ‚ÄúAt Agora we take food insecurity very seriously and focus on four pillars which are stability, utilization, access and availability. For example, when we think about accessibility, we‚Äôre cash and debit only, but if someone shows up with only their credit card, we‚Äôll give them a meal for free because payment method shouldn‚Äôt prevent you from being able to access food.‚Äù

For Cody, things have come full circle. Once food insecure himself, he is now addressing food insecurity on the UBC campus. And all of this started with the Centennial Scholars Entrance Award, which made attending UBC possible. [...] Today, Agora continues to thrive under Cody‚Äôs leadership. The caf√© serves 150 meals a day during the school year and the profits are used to fund community dinners twice a week, with roughly 100 free meals handed out at each event. After securing additional grant funding, Cody was able to lead the charge in opening a second Agora location on campus in March 2023 and he hopes to open a third location in the future. [...] In 2017 he applied to the Bachelor in Food and Nutritional Science program at UBC with a dream of one day owning his own food production company. Cody grew up in a small town in Nova Scotia in a food insecure household. Money was always tight and attending university would be difficult, so he applied for the Centennial Scholars Entrance Award‚Äîa donor-supported award that he was thrilled to receive.

‚ÄúThrough the award, donors gave me the opportunity to get my footing at UBC and helped me experience university in my own way,‚Äù says Cody. ‚ÄúThey gave me the financial stability to explore campus, get involved and try new things without having to worry about making rent or having enough money to buy groceries.‚Äù

results.title: 2023 - women in stem scholarship
results.content: has completed a total of 28 months in the cooperative education program at UBC. She worked as a project coordinator for EllisDon on one of Vancouver‚Äôs biggest development projects, Oakridge Park, communicating with both consultants and sub-trades to resolve deficiencies while advancing the project schedule. She was also employed as a structural engineering intern at Glotman Simpson, a world-class engineering firm located in Vancouver. There, she had the opportunity to design various structural elements of high-rise towers. Georgia is heavily involved in the community at UBC, volunteering for as many high school outreach events as she can, and is the graduation representative for the civil engineering student society, where she organizes events for the graduating class and civil [...] Georgia Rea Citizenship: Canada District 8 Pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs degree in applied science in civil engineering at University of British Columbia (UBC), Canada 2023 Women in STEM Scholar zonta.org/womenintech Sofia Ferreira Colman is a graduate student at the University of Hawai‚Äôi at Hilo where she is pursuing her master‚Äôs degree, and is part of the Multiscale Environmental Graphical Analysis (MEGA) Lab. Her research focuses on coral reef ecology where she employs innovative technologies such as underwater three-dimensional structure-from-motion techniques and machine learning to enhance the monitoring of these fragile ecosystems. [...] 2019 2023 WOMEN IN STEM SCHOLARSHIP Encouraging women to pursue education, career opportunities and leadership roles in technology 2023 Women in STEM Scholar zonta.org/womenintech Lily Chen is an undergraduate student at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), double majoring in mathematics and computer science. She has internship experience in quantitative finance and biostatistics. Her work now mainly focuses on natural language processing and artificial intelligence research. She co-led a research project on mitigating gender bias in Large Language Model (LLM)-based machine translation, which was accepted to Widening Natural Language Processing at Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (WiNLP @ EMNLP). As a research intern, Lily additionally co-led a project on

results.title: [PDF] A Self-Study for the Committee on Accreditation
results.content: important structural components and approaches that need to be in place for the program to be successful. These include the further development and maintenance of relationships between Indigenous communities and organizations and iSchool students and faculty (those teaching in the FNCC and others). A priority is to build relationships with the Musqueam nation on whose traditional and unceded territories UBC is situated. An example of steps in this direction is the Musqueam Resource Curation Project, a collaborative project in which iSchool faculty and students have been involved for the past several years. I.2.4 The importance of research to the advancement of the field's knowledge base; MLIS SLOs: 8, 10 All students take a core research methods course in their first year and most MLIS [...] ranking was introduced four years ago; in 2019 and 2020 our unit topped the ranking, making it the only academic unit in a Canadian university to rank first overall in any category.1 UBC is recognized as a leading university in Canada and one of the top 40 research universities globally. The current President, Benoit-Antoine Bacon began a five-year term as the 17th President and Vice-Chancellor on November 1, 2023. This follows a 6-year term of President Santa Ono, from 2016 to 2022, during which UBC‚Äôs current strategic plan, Shaping UBC‚Äôs Next Century (2018-2028) was introduced. UBC has grown during the previous accreditation period, with 70,000 enrolled students, including 12,500 graduate students, across the two main campuses, in Vancouver and Kelowna, in the BC Okanagan Valley. To date, the iSchool has more than 3500 graduates, many of whom play leading roles in libraries and information organizations in Western Canada, the Pacific Northwest, and internationally. results.title: Community Leadership Scholarships - TD Canada Trust
results.content:
Image 105

Jana Abdul-Rahim

Dawson College Laval, PQ

While 12-year-old Jana volunteered at Champleury Community Centre for fun and free food, she soon realized the positive impact of volunteering. To inspire youth interest in human rights, Jana planned Amnesty International (AI) conferences and grew her school chapter. As a member of AI‚Äôs National Youth Committee, she helped students across Quebec run campaigns, while she also organized an annual disabilities awareness show for youth with disabilities, including young artists. Jana helped start the Darna Youth Association to offer Palestinian youth a safe place to share their culture. Jana plans to study at McGill University and is considering a career in international law or economics.

Image 106

Keeley Aird [...] Jolie Gan

Sir Winston Churchill High School

Calgary, AB

When thirteen-year-old Jolie became a temporary, primary caregiver to her siblings, she realized how many kids face financial instability. Jolie founded Youth Leaders in Law (YLL) to help peers from disadvantaged communities explore law careers. They connected hundreds of students with lawyer volunteers to demystify the legal field. She also co-founded a speech camp with a local charity to help immigrant and disabled youth build confidence and find their voice. Jolie was a Royal Canadian Mounted Police National Youth Advisor and a student researcher at the University of Calgary‚Äôs law faculty.

Image 73

Ethan Hesler

Ancaster High School

Ancaster, ON [...] Image 116

Julian Krizsan

√âcole acadienne de Truro Truro, NS

Julian has shown how an open heart and mind lead to innovation and change. As the youngest board member of the Living Earth Council, a community environmental group, he planned local food events and promoted bike riding as sustainable transportation. An avid film-maker, Julian also ran a children‚Äôs agricultural program at the Truro Farmers‚Äô Market and, as President of the school Environmental Committee, he created an art installation from used plastics, prompting staff to ban plastic cutlery. Julian played in Acadian bands to show kids that their musical and French language heritage are cool. Julian would like to study industrial design and become an engineer or product designer.

Image 117

Alec Landry
